import pandas as pd
url = "../input/zillow-sale-counts-state/Sale_Counts_State.csv"
df_sales = pd.read_csv(url, low_memory=False)
pd.set_option('display.max_columns', None)
pd.set_option('display.max_rows', None)
df_sales.shape
source.26bb1ff6:
df = pd.melt(frame=df_sales, 
             id_vars=['RegionID','RegionName', 'SizeRank'], var_name='year-month', value_name='count')
df.head()
source.8f21e04b:
Following the tutorial from this Youtube Video to create Tidy data: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=49PKysycCGc

Zillow has public research data available at 
https://www.zillow.com/research/data/

For this example I downloaded the dataset from https://files.zillowstatic.com/research/public/State/Sale_Counts_State.csv
